values.title: Inclusivity
values.description: We welcome you, as you are, to join us in Spark SC.

values.title: Optimism
values.description: We welcome you, as you are, to join us in Spark SC.

values.title: Family
values.description: We welcome you, as you are, to join us in Spark SC.

committees.title: Startup Career Fair
committees.description: A flagship event in the spring semester, the Spark SC Startup Career Fair brings out top L.A. startups to connect with students in mid-February. Work on outreach and logistics to help strengthen USC’s connection to the startups in Los Angeles.

committees.title: State of the Arts
committees.description: State of the Arts is an art fair that exists at the confluence of art, food, fashion, entertainment and entrepreneurship. Build relationships with exhibitors, speakers, and community members, plan logistics, and work on marketing for this one-of-a-kind event.

committees.title: USC Hackers
committees.description: Make an impact in the USC coding and hacking community by joining USC Hackers. Throw monthly hack nights and large-scale events that lower the barriers of entry to hacking and bring the community together.

committees.title: Project Launch
committees.description: Design and manage a social entrepreneurship project, collaborate with nonprofit organizations, and give back to the surrounding Los Angeles community. Project Launch helps inner-city Los Angeles high school students build the hard skills, soft skills, and growth mindset they will need as leaders of the next generation.

committees.title: TechLA Fellows
committees.description: Help connect students with paid internships in Los Angeles through the TechLA Fellows program. Build the TechLA brand, familiarize yourself with LA companies and recruiters, and be the interface between USC and the LA startup community.

committees.title: Podcast
committees.description: Spark XM, the Spark SC Podcast, highlights outstanding faculty, alumni, and student entrepreneurs in entertaining 20 minute long podcast episodes. Help us plan, record, and produce great audio content that gets published to the iTunes podcast store.

committees.title: Safari
committees.description: This is your opportunity to get connected to the growing tech scene in Los Angeles—reach out to founders, build relationships with companies, and set up "field trips" to companies for students.

committees.title: Venture Studios
committees.description: Help connect students with paid internships in Los Angeles through the TechLA Fellows program. Build the TechLA brand, familiarize yourself with LA companies and recruiters, and be the interface between USC and the LA startup community.

committees.title: Media
committees.description: Spark SC hosts events that bring hundreds of students together and promote a culture of entrepreneurship at USC. Help us capture the excitement at our events through photography and videography, and produce videos for distribution to the community.

committees.title: Graphics
committees.description: Design and spread Spark SC’s vision. Create marketing campaigns and promotions so that the whole campus can see what we’re up to and get involved. See your work plastered on bulletins and event pages.

committees.title: A Mystery Committee
committees.description: Find a new opportunity that fits with Spark SC’s mission to inspire a culture of innovation, expose students to their creative potential, and connect makers across diverse communities.

questions.question: What is the application process?
questions.answer:
The application is three rounds:
  1. The written application [INSERT LINK], due [DUE DATE].
  2. An individual interview.
  3. A team-based group interview.

Applicants are notified as to their application status after every round, regardless if they are accepted into the next round. Shortly after the group interview, Spark SC will welcome its new class of "Sparklets!"

questions.question: How long is the application process?
questions.answer: The application process takes about 10 days, starting from the day the written application is due.

questions.question: Is Spark SC a computer science club?
questions.answer: Nope! We do much more than just coding and hacking.

questions.question: Do you have to be an engineering or business major to apply?
questions.answer: No! We want you to apply, whatever your major or interest. We have members from many schools at USC, and our members have a wide variety of skills and interests.
